content.question: Which of the following chi-square distributions has the smallest number of degrees of freedom?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph of a chi-square distribution. The horizontal axis is labeled chi-square, and the numbers 0 through 35, in increments of 5, are indicated. The distribution begins at 0 and ends at 35 and is skewed to the right. The distribution’s peak is at 13.

The figure presents a graph of a chi-square distribution. The horizontal axis is labeled chi-square, and the numbers 0 through 35, in increments of 5, are indicated. The distribution begins at 0 and ends at 35 and is skewed to the right. The distribution’s peak is at 4.

The figure presents a graph of a chi-square distribution. The horizontal axis is labeled chi-square, and the numbers 0 through 35, in increments of 5, are indicated. The distribution begins at 0 and ends at 35 and is skewed to the right. The distribution’s peak is at 11.

The figure presents a graph of a chi-square distribution. The horizontal axis is labeled chi-square, and the numbers 0 through 35, in increments of 5, are indicated. The distribution begins at 5 and ends at 35 and appears symmetric. The distribution’s peak is at 20.

The figure presents a graph of a chi-square distribution. The horizontal axis is labeled chi-square, and the numbers 0 through 35, in increments of 5, are indicated. The distribution begins at 0 and ends at 35 and is skewed to the left. The distribution’s peak is at 27.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph of a chi-square distribution. The horizontal axis is labeled chi-square, and the numbers 0 through 35, in increments of 5, are indicated. The distribution begins at 0 and ends at 35 and is skewed to the right. The distribution’s peak is at 4.
